verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came to him,) (after he had gone in to Bathsheba.) Be gracious<WH2603> to me, O God,<WH430> according to Thy lovingkindness;<WH2617> According to the greatness<WH7230> of Thy compassion<WH7356> blot<WH4229> out my transgressions.<WH6588>
Wash<WH3526> me thoroughly<WH7235> from my iniquity,<WH5771> And cleanse<WH2891> me from my sin.<WH9128>
For I know<WH3045> my transgressions,<WH6588> And my sin<WH9128> is ever<WH8548> before<WH5048> me.

Against Thee, Thee only,<WH905> I have sinned,<WH2398> And done<WH6213> what<WH7451> is evil<WH7451> in Thy sight,<WH5869> So<WH4616> that Thou art justified<WH6663> when Thou dost speak,<WH1696> And blameless<WH2135> when Thou dost judge.<WH8199>
Behold,<WH2005> I was brought<WH9123> forth<WH9123> in iniquity,<WH5771> And in sin<WH2399> my mother<WH517> conceived<WH3179> me.
Behold,<WH2005> Thou dost desire<WH2654> truth<WH571> in the innermost<WH2910> being,<WH2910> And in the hidden<WH5640> part<WH5640> Thou wilt make me know<WH3045> wisdom.<WH2451>
Purify<WH2398> me with hyssop,<WH231> and I shall be clean;<WH2891> Wash<WH3526> me, and I shall be whiter<WH3835> than<WH4480> snow.<WH7950>
Make me to hear<WH8085> joy<WH8342> and gladness,<WH8057> Let the bones<WH6106> which Thou hast broken<WH1794> rejoice.<WH1523>
Hide<WH5641> Thy face<WH6440> from my sins,<WH2399> And blot<WH4229> out all<WH3605> my iniquities.<WH5771>
Create<WH1254> in me a clean<WH2889> heart,<WH3820> O God,<WH430> And renew<WH2318> a steadfast<WH3559> spirit<WH7307> within<WH7130> me.
Do not cast<WH7993> me away<WH7993> from Thy presence,<WH6440> And do not take<WH3947> Thy Holy<WH6944> Spirit<WH7307> from me.
Restore<WH2318> to me the joy<WH8342> of Thy salvation,<WH3468> And sustain<WH5564> me with a willing<WH5082> spirit.<WH7307>
[Then] I will teach<WH3925> transgressors<WH6586> Thy ways,<WH1870> And sinners<WH2400> will be converted<WH7725> to Thee.
Deliver<WH5337> me from bloodguiltiness,<WH1818> O God,<WH430> Thou God<WH430> of my salvation;<WH8668> [Then] my tongue<WH3956> will joyfully<WH7442> sing<WH7442> of Thy righteousness.<WH6666>
O Lord,<WH136> open<WH6605> my lips,<WH8193> That my mouth<WH6310> may declare<WH5046> Thy praise.<WH8416>
For Thou dost not delight<WH2654> in sacrifice,<WH2077> otherwise I would give<WH5414> it; Thou art not pleased<WH7521> with burnt<WH5930> offering.<WH5930>
The sacrifices<WH2077> of God<WH430> are a broken<WH7665> spirit;<WH7307> A broken<WH7665> and a contrite<WH1794> heart,<WH3820> O God,<WH430> Thou wilt not despise.<WH959>
By Thy favor<WH7522> do<WH3190> good<WH3190> to Zion;<WH6726> Build<WH1129> the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Then<WH227> Thou wilt delight<WH2654> in righteous<WH6664> sacrifices,<WH2077> In burnt<WH5930> offering<WH5930> and whole<WH3632> burnt<WH3632> offering;<WH3632> Then<WH227> young<WH6499> bulls<WH6499> will be offered<WH5927> on Thine altar.<WH4196>
